headline: Target to cut 500 jobs to boost store staffing, according to CNBC
summary: Investing.com -- Target Corporation (NYSE:TGT) is reallocating its human capital to prioritize the customer experience as it grapples with four years of stagnant annual sales. According to reporting from CNBC, citing an internal email, the retailer will invest more in store labor while cutting approximately 500 roles in distribution centers and regional offices. The strategic shift follows mounting criticism from shoppers regarding out-of-stock items and increasingly long checkout lines. CEO Mic

headline: Is Ulta’s Inclusive Hairtech Push With Wavytalk Quietly Reshaping Its Competitive Edge (ULTA)?
summary: Wavytalk announced its official debut on Ulta.com on February 4, 2026, adding six professional-inspired styling tools and haircare products to Ulta Beauty’s online assortment, while being expanded its inclusive haircare reach in the U.S. through Target after already entering Ulta Beauty, Amazon, and CVS with varying assortments. Together, these partnerships underline Ulta Beauty’s emphasis on innovative styling technology and inclusive haircare, aiming to broaden its appeal across diverse...

headline: Target’s Big Spring Beauty Reset Puts Store Traffic And Valuation In Focus
summary: Target, NYSE:TGT, has rolled out its largest Spring beauty assortment to date alongside a refreshed in store beauty experience. The update includes new and expanded brands, broader product lines, and interactive beauty events aimed at drawing shoppers back into stores. The launch comes as the company works to address recent customer dissatisfaction and softer store traffic. Target shares recently closed at $115.55, with the stock up 5.5% over the past week, 9.5% over the past month, and...

headline: Dollar General's Shrink Reduction Is Now the Key Margin Tailwind
summary: DG's push to curb inventory shrink fuels a 107-basis-point gross margin jump in Q3 FY25, making shrink reduction its biggest margin driver.

headline: Indian yarn maker Trident posts quarterly profit slump as exports soften
summary: Feb 9 (Reuters) - Indian towel and bedsheet maker Trident reported a 44% fall in profit on Monday, as a U.S. tariff-triggered slowdown in exports squeezed sales during the third quarter.

raw.headline: Indian yarn maker Trident posts quarterly profit slump as exports soften

headline: 3 Low-Volatility Stocks We Steer Clear Of
